articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Chongryon Chairman
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Chongryon Chairman
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Sunday sent a message of congratulations to Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). 
					 The message said:
					
					 Please accept my warm congratulations to you, working hard with patriotism, on your 80th birthday. 
					
					 You have made great contributions to developing Chongryon into the Juche-oriented overseas Koreans' organization with strict ideological and leadership system of Juche, true to the idea and leadership of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for many years. 
					
					 Our people highly appreciate the precious patriotic activities of you, who have devoted everything to the work for national reunification, prosperity of your homeland and development of the movement of Koreans in Japan with ardent loyalty and patriotism. 
					
					 I wish good health to you and happiness to your family, hoping that you will further develop Chongryon and the movement of Koreans in Japan, full of energy despite your advanced age, as intended by the Generalissimos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Paek Po Hum
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Paek Po Hum
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un on Sunday sent a wreath to the bier of Paek Po Hum, winner of Kim Il Sung Prize and Kim Jong Il Prize and writer of the April 15 Literary Production Centre, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK Foreign Ministry Returns Home
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK Foreign Ministry Returns Home
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry headed by Vice-Minister Ri Kil Song returned home on Saturday after visiting Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, Myanmar, Singapore, Indonesia and Malaysia.

articles.title: Japan's Shameless Moves to Grab Tok Islets Denounced
articles.content:
Japan's Shameless Moves to Grab Tok Islets Denounced
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are getting evermore outrageous in their moves to grab Tok Islets so as to realize their scenario for territorial expansion. 
					 On February 13 the south Korean KBS said the foreign minister of Japan in his regular diplomatic briefing let loose reckless remarks that Tok Islets belong to "territory of Japan". 
					
					 An animation file titled "Japan's consistent stand on dominium over Tok Islets" is posted on the homepage of the Japanese Foreign Ministry. It shamelessly asserts that Tok Islets are "part of the inviolable territory of Japan in the light of historical facts and from the viewpoint of international law". 
					
					 Japan is now busy conducting such propaganda through internet. 
					
					 The minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology is pressurizing adoption of textbooks which say Tok Islets are "part of the inviolable territory" of Japan, insisting that "it is quite natural for the government to educate students in the inviolable territory of Japan". 
					
					 Japan described Tok Islets as part of the territory of Japan in its "defense white paper" this year, too, just as it did last year. 
					
					 Japan is set to dispatch again a vice minister of its government to the ceremony of the "Takeshima (Tok Islets) day" in Shimane Prefecture on February 22, revealing its wild ambition to grab the islets.
					
					 Tok islets are part of the inviolable territory of Korea recognized by history and international law.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' brazen-faced moves to grab Tok islets are a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of the Korean nation and an illegal brigandish act that can never be justified.
					
					 The impudent and undisguised moves of Japan to seize Tok islets are a repetition of the Japanese imperialists' past moves for aggression.
					
					 It is the ulterior design of Japan to reinvade Korea with Tok islets as a springboard.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are running the whole gamut of desperate moves to grab Tok islets, seized by its wild ambition for territorial expansion. However, they should bear in mind this is no more than a daydream.

articles.title: Many Technological Innovation Proposals Introduced into Production
articles.content:
Many Technological Innovation Proposals Introduced into Production
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Members of the April 15 Technological Innovation Shock Brigades in different sectors of the national economy introduced more than 20 000 technological innovation proposals into production  over the past one year.
					 Those of the shock brigade in the agricultural sector brought about innovations in the farming methods and contributed to putting the production on a scientific and intensive basis.
					
					 The members of the shock brigade at the Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City made sure that the production of grain was increased with less fertilizers and contributed to raising the per-hectare yield of rice by settling issues arising in the expansion of organic composite fertilizer production bases and the introduction of high-yielding crops.
					
					 Those of the shock brigade in the light industrial sector are displaying the vitality of the mass technological innovation movement.
					
					 Those in the electrical power industrial sector settled many issues arising in boosting power production and cutting down electricity consumption.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Blasts S. Korean Provincial Governor's Pro-Japanese Remarks
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Blasts S. Korean Provincial Governor's Pro-Japanese Remarks
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea on Feb. 12 issued a statement condemning the pro-Japanese reckless remarks made by the governor of Kyonggi Province, south Korea.
					 The statement accused Nam Kyong Phil, governor of the province, of what he said on Feb. 10, when meeting with the Japanese prime minister. Nam behaved so meanly as to beg the Japanese prime minister to reconsider the "issue of civilian fund," it noted, and continued:
					
					 It is an act of treachery to make the sexual slavery a scapegoat to please Japan under the present situation. It is intolerable for Nam to cry out for improving the relations with Japan keen to rub salt in the wounds of the victims of the sexual slavery.    
					
					 The statement urged Nam to behave properly, well aware of what the victims want.

articles.title: Japan's Official Apology for Sexual Slavery Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Official Apology for Sexual Slavery Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The 1 166th Wednesday meeting demanding the settlement of the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army took place in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul, according to a south Korean internet paper.
					 Speakers at the meeting slammed Japan for evading an official apology and legal reparation for its past crimes though 70 years have passed since Japan's defeat. 
					
					 They condemned the Japanese government for working hard to delete the description about the forcible drafting of Korean women as sexual slaves in a U.S. history textbook.
					
					 This is an insult not only to the victims but also to those who have made efforts to seek the settlement of their issue.
					
					 They demanded the Japanese government, a war criminal state, make an official apology for the sexual slavery.

articles.title: U.S. Moves to Build Missile Shield under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Moves to Build Missile Shield under Fire in S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- 39 civic and social bodies of  south Korea, including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty, Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, Solidarity for Progress and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, held a press conference in front of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Feb. 13 at which they condemned the U.S. moves to build a missile shield.
					 The organizations accused high-ranking officials of the U.S. Departments of State and Defense of repeatedly asserting the discussion on the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.
					
					 This is an undisguised revelation of the U.S. intention to deploy THAAD in south Korea at any cost by pressurizing its regime, they held.
					
					 They demanded the south Korean and U.S. authorities halt at once the moves to deploy THAAD in south Korea.

articles.title: Actions to Probe Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions to Probe Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster Staged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Bereaved families of the Ferry Sewol disaster and civic and public organizations in south Korea are protesting against the puppet authorities who are not opting for probing the truth despite the lapse of more than 300 days since the disaster.
					 The consultative council of the bereaved families formed a march group and staged it on Jan. 26. The members of the group called for salvaging the sunken ship at an early date in order to probe the truth about the disaster.
					
					 They held a rally at Phaengmok Port in Jin Island, South Jolla Province on Feb. 14. At the rally speakers underlined the need to find out the missing persons at an early date and send them to their families.
					
					 They urged the present chief executive to opt for finding out those missing to the last man as she had promised the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Papers
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Russian papers carried a special write-ups illustrated with the portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il and his photos on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 Pri Armurskiye Wedomostsi on February 11 said that Kim Jong Il was a great master of independent politics specially recorded in the history of world politics. It went on:
					
					 His political philosophy is the Juche idea recognized by the international community as the idea guiding the cause of independence.
					
					 The most important of his political exploits is the Songun politics.  The might and vitality of his independent politics were fully demonstrated in the fact that he ushered in the exciting June 15 era of reunification in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The august name of the great man who led the cause of socialism in Korea and the human cause of independence to victory will shine forever in the history of the world politics as the great master of independent politics.
					
					 Komsomolskaya Pravda on February 7 devoted its full page to articles under the headline "Legacy of General Secretary Kim Jong Il".
					
					 The paper recalled that he glorified the Juche idea and Songun idea as the eternal guiding idea of Korea and the great guiding idea for the cause of independence.
					
					 The paper on February 13 said in an article titled "Eternal Chairman of the National Defence Commission" that his exploits would shine forever with the eternal prosperity of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Figures
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Laos, Norway and Austria between February 10 and 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues of the meetings were photos documenting exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Displayed there were photos and books introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 The chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association paid the highest tribute to Kim Jong Il who performed immortal exploits on behalf of the era and history, holding aloft the banner of Songun.
					
					 The chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway lauded him as a great statesman who firmly protected the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the happiness of the people, provided a solid foundation for the building of a thriving socialist nation and safeguarded peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia by pursuing the Songun politics.
					
					 The chairman of the Advisory Committee of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK said that Kim Jong Il is always alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also humankind as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Norway and Austria.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised in Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK photo and book exhibitions took place in Indonesia, Guinea and Germany between February 6 and 16 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and photos and books introducing the struggle of the Korean army and people.
					
					 The curator and the vice-curator of the Folklore Museum of Indonesia said Kim Jong Il is always alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also progressive humankind for his great exploits.
					
					 He is an outstanding leader who turned the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state and military power, they added.
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea praised Kim Jong Il as the great leader in the era of independence who devoted his all to the happiness of the Korean people and the global cause of independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said:
					
					 The DPRK is a beacon of hope for the world progressives.
					
					 It is firmly carrying forward the tradition of invincible victory in the confrontation with the U.S. and the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We will positively support the just struggle of the Korean people in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated in Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- Delegations of political parties, organizations, institutions and personages in different countries paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions in relevant countries from February 12 to 16 to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The visitors included delegations of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, Workers' Party of Mexico, Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and Leader Kim Jong Il, Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea and Mexico-Korea Friendship Association, delegations of Peruvian political parties, organizations and institutions, including the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru, Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting's Union, Peruvian Committee for Remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru, Peruvian People's Women Union, Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk, Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for the Study of 
					
					 Juche Songun Policy and the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, delegation of the Secretariat of the Uganda National Resistance Movement, the first vice-chairman of the Central Council of the Communist Parties-the Communist Party of the Soviet Union who is secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation and his party and personages of the Uzbekistan-DPRK Friendship Forum.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and their full-length paintings and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in UK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in UK
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on Feb. 9 posted on its internet homepage the part dealing with Korea's reunification and the foreign policy of the DPRK in the New Year Address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Film Shows Held Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Film Shows Held Abroad
Pyongyang, February 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK film shows took place in Romania, Thailand and Indonesia between February 10 and 13 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Participants watched the Korean films "International Friendship Exhibition House" and "Korea Today".
					
					 Present there were figures of the Party for Socialist Choice of Romania, the Romanian Workers' Association, the Romania-Korea Friendship Association, the World Cereals Company of Thailand, the Sun Food Company of Thailand and the Adita Ariya Prawira Ship Co. of Indonesia and masses.
					
					 The director of the World Cereals Company of Thailand said that he realized where is the source of strength of the Korean people who are dynamically building a thriving nation, undeterred by the U.S. economic pressure and military threat.
					
					 The chief for marketing of the Sun Food Company of Thailand and other speakers said they felt more deeply the boundless reverence of the progressives for Kim Jong Il. He performed immortal exploits not only in the ideological and theoretical aspects but also in the national defence field, they added.
					
					 The director of the Adita Ariya Prawira Ship Co. of Indonesia expressed the will to make positive efforts to introduce the DPRK to help the world people have proper viewpoints and understanding of it under the situation where the U.S. and other hostile forces are putting economic sanctions on socialist Korea and kicking up a "human rights" racket to stifle it.
